page.title: 12LANDSCAPE
page.content: The block lies in an area of great natural beauty and is close to many places of interest. It is on the edge of 'Tennyson Country' with his home at Somersby Rectory lying nearby. Harrington Hall, the presumed setting for "Maud" is about 10km. away. It is an impressive house with pleasant gardens and a garden-centre. Both house and gardens are often open to the public. The East Coast resorts of Mablethorpe and Skegness are nearby, and there are many interesting small villages and churches within easy reach. There are many pleasant and varied walks in and around the block. The only accomodation in the block is a youth hostel. Being an agricultural area, tourism is not actively encouraged.
